Demo Shennong Object

Source: R/data.R
so.Rd

A compact example `Shennong` object for demonstration and testing. Includes two assays, multiple data layers, dimensionality reductions, and sample metadata.

Usage

data(so)

Format

A `Shennong` object with:

2 assays

RNA, ATAC

3 layers in RNA

counts, data (log1p), scale.data (z-scored)

2 reductions

pca (via prcomp), mds (via cmdscale)

20 samples with metadata

condition (Normal or Tumor),
gender (Male or Female),
age (integer from 40–70)

200 genes

Shared across both assays

Examples

data(so)
so
#> A Shennong object:  Shennong 
#> Organism: NA 
#> A Shennong object of 2 listed
#>  experiments with user-defined names and respective classes.
#>  Containing an ExperimentList class object of length 2:
#>  [1] RNA: SummarizedExperiment with 200 rows and 20 columns
#>  [2] ATAC: SummarizedExperiment with 200 rows and 20 columns
#> Functionality:
#>  experiments() - obtain the ExperimentList instance
#>  colData() - the primary/phenotype DataFrame
#>  sampleMap() - the sample coordination DataFrame
#>  `$`, `[`, `[[` - extract colData columns, subset, or experiment
#>  *Format() - convert into a long or wide DataFrame
#>  assays() - convert ExperimentList to a SimpleList of matrices
#>  exportClass() - save data to flat files
#> 
#> --- Shennong Specific Slots ---
#> Active Assay: RNA 
#> Active Ident: 2 levels (first few: Normal, Tumor ) 
#> 2 dimensional reduction(s) present: pca, mds 
#> Misc data: None 
#> Command history stored: Yes 
#> Tools data stored: None 
#> Object created with ShennongObject version: 0.1.0 
sn_assays(so)
#> [1] "RNA"  "ATAC"
sn_layers(so, assay = "RNA")
#> [1] "counts"     "data"       "scale.data"
sn_reductions(so)
#> [1] "pca" "mds"
sn_metadata(so)
#> # A tibble: 20 × 6
#>    observation condition gender   age nFeature_RNA nCount_RNA
#>    <chr>       <chr>     <chr>  <dbl>        <dbl>      <dbl>
#>  1 sample1     Normal    Male      42          137       1327
#>  2 sample2     Normal    Female    46          138       1338
#>  3 sample3     Normal    Male      43          128       1290
#>  4 sample4     Normal    Female    68          142       1379
#>  5 sample5     Normal    Male      42          145       1433
#>  6 sample6     Normal    Female    63          148       1527
#>  7 sample7     Normal    Male      61          138       1380
#>  8 sample8     Normal    Female    42          128       1274
#>  9 sample9     Normal    Male      42          140       1374
#> 10 sample10    Normal    Female    48          136       1349
#> 11 sample11    Tumor     Male      67          140       1399

#> 13 sample13    Tumor     Male      48          133       1350
